Department Description: Most of City Council's funding comes from general fund dollars which pay for passing legislation, staff, hosting public meetings, and overseeing government functions.
General Fund dollars pay for benefits administration, city utilities, executive staff, City budget office, city vehicle repair and fuel costs among many other things.
Most of the Law Department's funding comes from the general fund to pay for legal services for the city, police litigation, as well as enforcing traffic violations.
All of the Fire Department's funding comes from the general fund to pay for salaries, pensions and firefighting activities.
Safety and Permit's budget primarily comes from the general fund paying for regulation of permits as well as a one stop shop to acquire business licenses.
$130 of NOPD's $140 million dollar budget comes from the general fund. The General Fund budget is spent on field operations, department management, investigation services and pensions.
All of Sanitation's funding comes form the general fund, paying for core sanitaiton services including garbage disposal.
Department of Health general fund expendatures primarily pay for emergency medical services.
The General Fund covers most of the administrative, food, and medical costs of the youth study center.
All of the Department of Finance's funding comes from the general fund to pay for servicing debts.
General fund dollars for property management pay for the directors office and facilities maitenance.
Civil Serice is exclusively funded by the General Fund and uses most of its funding to recruit, develop and maintain a qualified staff of city employees.
The Public Works general fund pays for parking enforcement, street lights, traffic engineering and street maintenance.
Parks and Parkways general fund dollars go toward paying for park maintenance, park planning, and golf course maintenance.
HDLC in entirely funded by the General Fund. Those dollars pay for maintaining historical buildings and landmarks around New Orleans.
VCC is paid for by the General Fund and pays to make sure buildings are up to code in the French Quarter.
ABC is funded through the general fund and pays for liquor license hearings
CPC's general fund dollars go to pay for core services including reviewing over 500 land use applications per year

Department: Mosquito, Termite and Rodent Control Board
Department Description: MTRCB's core funding, provide from the general fund, pays for management of pests throughout the city
NOMA is paid for by the general fund which covers museum operations and acquisitions.
The Office of the Inspector General is paid for primarily by the General Fund. This funding pays for staff, ethical review boards, and fraud investigations.
Community Developmen receives no General Fund dollars
The New Orleans DA is funded by the General Fund. The funding pays for core services including staff and trial expenses, along with funding the Innocence Project.
The Coroner's funding comes completely through the General Fund.

Juvenile Court is paid for through the General Fund with most of the money going to pay for receptions, resources and skills center, whose goal is to assist judges in finding appropriate programs for youth, decrease the amount of time spent in custody, ensure youth appear in court when mandated, and protect public safety.
First City Court only recieves General Fund dollars from the City of New Orleans.
Civil Court only receives General Fund dollars from the City of New Orleans.
Municipal court only receives General Fund dollars.
Traffic Court only recives General Fund dollars.
The Criminal Court is paid for by the General Fund. The funding pays for the Tulane Learning Tower, jury expenses, and court staffing.
The Sheriff's entire budget is provided by the General Fund to pay for criminal expenses and personnel costs.
The Clerk's budget pays for administrative costs, court costs, and pre court costs.
The registar's budget is provided by the General Fund a pays for the process of voter registration and compliance with election codes.
The General Fund pays the pension system for retired judges.
The Mayor's Office's core funding pays for the Neighborhood Engagement Office, communications, and the actual Mayor's Office.
They Mayor's Office public safety spending pays for NOLA FOR LIFE, and Criminal Justice Coordiantion to create efficencies in the criminal justice system.

Short Title: Office of Cultural Economy/Office of Economic Development
Department Description: The Mayor's Office of Cultural Economy creates opportunities for the film, arts, music and culinary industries. The Office of Ecnomic Development works to bring job and business opportunities to New Orleans.
The Community Development Office fights blight and creates affordable housing in the city of New Orleans.

Short Title: Service and Innovation/Office of Performance Accountability/Worker's Compensation
Department Description: The Service and Innovation team works to find effeciences in city contracts and structure. The Office of Performance Accountability promotes better city services through data reporting to residents.
The NOPD consent decree fullfills federal mandates to improve the police department. The Public Defender's Office provides legal representation to those who cannot afford it.
The Summer Youth programs gives youth ages 13-21 summer work experience that give them job skills for the real world. TIF funds offer tax incentives to business creating jobs in New Orleans.

Short Title: Participation Grants: SPCA/LSU Ag Center/Regional Planning Commission
NORD/Participation Funds: Department on Aging, Veterans Affairs, TCA
Department Description: The New Orleans Recreation Development Commission runs parks, community centers, and programming at facities across New Orleans.
City Council Other Fund dollars come from self-generated revenues or special funds.
Other Fund dollars under the CAO operate the Office of Homeland Security and come from federal grants.
Law Department Other Fund dollars come from the Housing Improvement Fund as well as state and local foundation grants.
Safety and Permit's Other Funding comes from a combination of federal grants as well as state and local foundation grants.
Some Other Funds are available to the NOPD through federal and state programs that pay for forensic testing, the D.A.R.E program, violent crime and sexual assault task forces.
Other funding for the Health Department comes from federal grants along with state and local foundation grants.
Some federal funding covers administrative costs.
Public Works Other Fund dollars come from HUD.
Parks and Parkways Other Fund dollars come from trust funds or are self generated and pay for golf course maintenance and park planning.
The NOPL is almost exclusively funded by Other Fund dollars from a dedicated millage that pay for library operations and self-generated funds.
CPC's other fund dollars come from local and state foundation grants.

Department: Mosquito, Termite and Rodent Control Board
Department Description: MTRCB's other funded is provided by trust funds, self generated revenue, and grants.
Other funding for the Inspector General comes from state, local, and federal grants for oversight of programs like Recovery School District facility construction.
Other Fund dollars pay for blight reduction and economic development programs.

The New Orleans Aviation Board represents the City in all aviation matters in consultation with state, national, and international government agencies. It is an unattached board under the executive branch of the New Orleans City Government.

The Delgado Albania Plantation Commission provides for the administration, operation and maintenance of the Delgado Albania Plantation, has authority, with the approval of the City Council, to borrow money to produce crops, and mortgage and pledge as security thereof, the crops and chattels of said plantation, and transmits annually to the Board of City Trusts for the account of the Delgado Community College and its successor such portion of the income of the plantation as may be fixed by the City Council.
The French Market Corporation oversees and operates the French Market properties, including the Flea Market and Farmers Market.
Local government corporation organized for the purpose of renovating and operating the Upper Pontalba Building.
The Municipal Yacht Harbor Management Corporation administers and manages the Municipal Yacht Harbor properties in the City of New Orleans.

The Orleans Parish Communication District (OPCD) is the administrative office of 9-1-1 for the City of New Orleans. OPCD purchases and maintains equipment and provides training for new and experienced police, fire and emergency medical personnel.
The purpose of the New Orleans Building Corporation is to own, lease, develop and operate properties owned by the City of New Orleans or by the Corporation.

The Rivergate Development Corporation (RDC) is a city-operated, non-profit, public benefit corporation founded in 1993 for the purpose of providing for the improvement and commercial development of the Rivergate Convention Center property.
The Canal Street Development Corporation stimulates business development in the Central Business District and the adaptive reuse and development of Canal Street for commercial purposes.

The Piazza d'Italia Development Corporation (PDDC) is a city-operated, non-profit, public benefit corporation founded in 1990 for the purpose of providing for the maintenance, improvement, and commercial development of the Piazza d'Italia in accordance with its architectural and cultural integrity.
The Mayor's Office sometimes receives federal or state grants, such as the Rockafeller Resilient Cities grant, that work towards open and effective government.

The federal government provides significant funding for homeland security and emergency preparedness. Some state and federal monies are also available to help meet the criteria of the federal consent decrees.

Short Title: Office of Cultural Economy/Office of Economic Development
Department Description: Federal and state dollars help pay for tourism incentives, film tax credits, and job training.
The Office of Community Development receives federal grants (CDBG) and HUD funding to provide affordable housing to New Orleanians.
Some federal money was once available to provide assistance to those living with HIV/AIDS under the Ryan White Fund.

Short Title: Service and Innovation/Office of Performance Accountability
Department Description: Funding for the Service and Innovation and Performance and Accountability Offices are provided mostly through General Funds. Previously, Intergovernmental funds had been accounted for here to create internal efficencies.
Some state and federal monies are also available to help meet the criteria of the federal consent decrees.
Formerly called JOB1, some federal money was available to help low income job seekers gain workforce skills.
CDBG and HUD funds available to NORDC are accounted for here.
Funding for the New Orleans Recreational Development Corporation from state and federal sources.
